How can I use the `reconsiderblock` command to remove the invalidity status of a block and its descendants?

You can use the `reconsiderblock` command by running the following command in the terminal:
```
verus reconsiderblock "blockhash"
```
Replace `"blockhash"` with the actual hash of the block you want to reconsider.

reconsiderblock "hash" Removes invalidity status of a block and its descendants, reconsider them for activation. This can be used to undo the effects of invalidateblock. Arguments: 1. hash  (string, required) the hash of the block to reconsider Result: Examples: > verus reconsiderblock "blockhash" > curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "reconsiderblock", "params": ["blockhash"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
